Articles.Content:
I`ve started a save with this as the first launch.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I`m going to launch at least ten of them. You spin them up and then fire off the action groups. Each launch will make about 300 pieces of debris. I`ll put the first one on a circular 80km equatorial orbit. The next will be 80x100, 80x250 and pretty much any orbit I think of until the whole sky is fast moving pieces of debris.

I`ve put one on a retrograde 80km orbit and one on a polar 80km orbit already.

When the sky is filled with more debris than can be counted then I will start my space program.

I`ll keep you posted (irregularly)

If anyone has an idea for an orbit, I can go to a max of 80x250

Orbits already in place

80x80

82x75

40x250

80x250

80x80(retro, 180 inc)

80x80(10 degree inc)

80x80 polar

Edited March 23, 2014 by John FX

Try making the biggest ship you can and get through the cloud.

[movie spoiler]

Or do a Gravity and go on EVA near where the debris is thickest.

Ok I have reached 2323 pieces of debris and I have great lag.

It`s time to go to the Mun!

Jeb, bill and bob are on the pad in KerPollo 8P (Prototype) preparing to launch to an 80km orbit (where most of the debris is)

I think, yes, they will have to EVA for some reason more concerned with plot than physics.
Bob is looking concerned that they can see so much debris from the window and they are not very high at all yet.
I think you should put debris on inclined orbits as well, not just polar and retro.

Joh FX - Your are insane! And I love it! ;-)

Good luck... Seriously! I'll be watching this thread.
I`ve put some on a 10 degree inclination but everything is so laggy now I`m not sure I can put much more up there.
Here is a video of an EVA to a piece of debris
How is that laggy? I don't think i've ever had frame-rates that high.

You don't need pieces that big. Chances to hit them are low already, a metre or to doesn't mean a thing. It is possible to launch hundreds of pieces at once, and it can be very compact.. Just use those small blue separators spaced radially, 8-fold symmetry. 64 of them per "floor", and then stack lots of such floors. Action grouping is a mess, but hey... It's compact.

I did a similar thing few days ago and I actually tried to EVA rendezvous with a small cubic strut.
Now to make two space stations, a telescope and a Shuttle, then reenact Gravity.
Sorry about that, anyway, that's a really nice looking Kessler bomb.

The video is speeded up. I get about 3 frames per second playing with no active flights...

even with over 2000 pieces of debris I don`t think I`ll get hit by any soon.

The lag really isn`t worth it.
Watching that video and seeing bits of debris streak past at 4 km/s really unsettled me...
It is strange to tell that something 20k away is moving fast...
